qas.question: How old was the mummified man discovered at the Austrian-Italian bored?
What culture was well established by the 6th Century BC?
Who famously crossed the Alps with a herd of elephants?
What person took an army of 40,000 across the mountain passes?
Where was Adolf Hitlers base of operation during World War 2?

context: A mummified man, determined to be <a0_0>5,000 years old<a0_0/>, was discovered on a glacier at the Austrian–Italian border in 1991. By the 6th century BC, <a1_0>the Celtic La Tène culture<a1_0/> was well established. <a2_0>Hannibal<a2_0/> famously crossed the Alps with a herd of elephants, and the Romans had settlements in the region. In 1800 <a3_0>Napoleon<a3_0/> crossed one of the mountain passes with an army of 40,000. The 18th and 19th centuries saw an influx of naturalists, writers, and artists, in particular the Romantics, followed by the golden age of alpinism as mountaineers began to ascend the peaks. In World War II, Adolf Hitler kept a base of operation in the <a4_0>Bavarian Alps<a4_0/> throughout the war.
